sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The French President Emmanuel Macron is in Beijing to meet his Chinese counterpart Xi Jinping to reset bilateral relations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Israeli police stormed the Al-Aqsa Mosque in Jerusalem early Wednesday morning, injuring dozens of Palestinians.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Nine men appear in a Brussels court to face charges for their alleged role in the deadly 2016 bombings in the Belgian capital.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The French president has arrived in Beijing at the start of a three-day visit to China

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: in what's been billed as an attempt to reset European relations with the Asian superpower.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Emmanuel Macron will be joined by the Europeana, Ursula von der Leyen...

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: ...en una reunión con el líder chinés, Xi Jinping.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: La Ucrania espera que sea alta en la agenda con los visitantes europeos...

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: ...que desean desvanecer a China de tomar el lado de Rusia en la guerra.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Beijing ha declinado a condenar la invasión...

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: ...y Xi recientemente regresó de un viaje a Moscú en un piso para aumentar las relaciones bilaterales.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Ana Latharo tiene más de Beijing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Uno de los objetivos del viaje de Emmanuel Macron y Ursula von der Leyen... a Moscú para aumentar los tiempos bilaterales. Ana Latharo tiene más de Beijing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Uno de los objetivos del viaje de Macron y Ursula von der Leyen es convencer a China para que no envíe armas letales a Rusia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Y la presidenta de la Comisión Europea ya ha dejado claro que de esto va a depender el futuro de las relaciones entre la Unión Europea y China.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Pero está por ver cuál es el margen de maniobra de los europeos para persuadir, para convencer. En cualquier caso, para el presidente francés parece claro que China es en estos momentos uno de los pocos países que tiene capacidad para influir en el desarrollo del conflicto. En este viaje también se va a hablar de comercio, de cómo equilibrar la balanza y sobre todo de cómo reducir la dependencia europea de China, lo que en Bruselas ha dado en llamarse reducción de riesgos.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: En los últimos tiempos la Unión Europea ha endurecido el tono respecto a China, pero en menor grado que Estados Unidos.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Y esta es la baza que podrían jugar los europeos en sus conversaciones con el presidente chino Xi Jinping.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Ana Lázaro, Euronews, Pekín. from Gaza into southern Israel, prompting an Israeli airstrike on the Palestinian territory.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Israeli police say they stormed the mosque after young people brought fireworks, sticks and stones into the building, then barricaded themselves inside.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: One officer was reportedly injured and dozens were arrested.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: This comes as Muslims mark the holy month Ramadan and Jews begin to prepare for Passover.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Outside, police use stun guns and rubber bullets against a crowd of people.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: In Gaza, Israeli forces reportedly attacked two weapons manufacturing centers. Similar events from two years ago erupted into an 11-day war between Israel and Hamas. The Press

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Handcuffed and escorted by the police, nine alleged jihadists appeared in a Brussels court today to face charges for their role in three suicide bombings in 2016, the deadliest peacetime attacks on Belgian soil.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The crimes they charged with include murder, attempted murder and membership or participation in the acts of a terrorist group.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Today is the first time since the trial opened in December last year that the suspects will be questioned by the judge.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The trial is expected to last until the summer.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The first two explosions took place in the departure hall at Brussels airport, just before eight in the morning.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: An hour later, the second attack occurred when a suicide bomber blew himself up in a train carriage at a station on a central Brussels metro line.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: 32 people died and some 300 others were injured in the attacks.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Donald Trump has slammed his charges of 34 counts of fraud in a New York court.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Calling it election interference and a witch hunt, he returned to his Florida home to give a primetime TV address.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Many expected a blistering response, but instead it was a campaign speech.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: He says his lawyers believe there is no case against him.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: And I never thought anything like this could happen in America.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Never thought it could happen.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The only crime that I have committed is to fearlessly defend our nation from those who seek to destroy it.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: So much more. Our elections were like those of a third world country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: And now this massive election interference at a scale never seen before in our country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Without a doubt, Trump's earlier court appearance was a moment of history, marking the first time a former U.S. president has been charged with a crime.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Those charges, to which he has pleaded not guilty, involve falsifying business records in which prosecutors allege was a conspiracy to influence the 2016 presidential election by silencing claims of extramarital affairs.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Under New York state law is a felony to falsify business records with intent to defraud and intent to conceal another crime. That is exactly what this case is about. 34 false statements That is exactly what this case is about. Thirty-four false statements made to cover up other crimes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: While Republicans have largely rallied around Trump, Democrats have been notably quiet.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The former president is running for a second term in the White House, but he's facing a series of separate criminal investigations that could result in further charges between now and Election Day.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: A warm welcome between the closest of allies. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky's visit

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: to Poland is seen as a gesture of thanks to its neighbor that has welcomed more Ukrainian refugees than any other, over one and a half million.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Zelensky has made only a few trips outside the country since Russia's invasion, all to Ukraine's most powerful allies.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: This visit is unusual in that it was announced in advance and he was accompanied by his wife Olena.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Poland recently unveiled plans to give around a dozen MiG-29 fighter jets to Ukraine, the latest and arguably most significant military donation to its war effort to date.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Warsaw was also among the first nations to offer Western tanks and other modern artillery and armaments.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Zelensky will also meet some Ukrainian refugees living in Poland, as well as take part in an economic forum on his country's future reconstruction.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The U.S. has unveiled details of a new military aid package to Ukraine worth 2.3 billion euros. It includes ammunition for Patriot air defense systems as well as anti-tank missiles. This as politicians as well as representatives from the business world and charitable organizations arrive in Kyiv to talk about post-war development.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Ukraine's president met the delegates led led by former U.S. Secretary of State Mike Pompeo.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: As Finland is welcomed into NATO, becoming the military alliance's 31st member, its chief also restated the group's commitment to Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Our meeting today underscored NATO's enduring commitment to Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Allies are ramping up the production of weapons and ammunition and delivering on their pledges of training and new heavy weaponry.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: A strong, independent Ukraine is vital for the stability of the Euro-Atlantic area.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: And we look forward to meeting President Zelensky at our Vilnius summit in July.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Russia's defense minister told military commanders in Moscow the accession of Finland into the military alliance increased the risk of wider conflict.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: He also confirmed Russia had provided allied country Belarus with missiles that can carry conventional or nuclear warheads.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Soldiers of the Belarusian army have begun training in Russia on the operation and maintenance of the Iskander-M tactical missile system, capable of using nuclear warheads. The training comes two weeks after

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Vladimir Putin announced that he will deploy tactical nuclear weapons on Belarus's border with NATO members Latvia, Lithuania and Poland. Vienna Centre researcher Nikolai Sakhov ponders the different scenarios. Nuclear weapons are political weapons. So right now we don't have specific information. So the number will likely be low, something like 10-20. We don't really talk about very large numbers. Everyone really talks about aircraft, so it should be gravity bombs for aircraft. A warning message seems to lead Vladimir Putin to cross another red line.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: This time the message is aimed directly at Poland, according to the researcher.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Now, I'm pretty sure that since we are talking about short-range weapons, the main target in this case is not the whole NATO, but really Poland. Poland has been always at the front lines of assistance to Ukraine, pushing everyone.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Poland advocates a very tough approach to Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: It's really talking about completely defeating Russia, changing regime.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: So we're really talking about escalation at that specific kind of front.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: It's unknown when Russia will move its nuclear weapons to Belarus and where exactly they will be located.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Moscow says it is building facilities to store the weaponry in the neighbouring country and that they will be ready by the 1st of July.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: It has also announced that it is working to modernise Belarusian aircraft so that they can carry such weapons, indicating that the announcement of the move could take time.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: We cannot be sure, but it seems that Russia will not actually move nuclear weapons to Belarus.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: So next stage will be construction of a storage facility.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Conversion of aircraft is reportedly being done right now as well as training the crews, right? But the actual movement of warheads will probably be the next kind of signal. It will be a separate step. So everything is now ready. But whether actually Russia will move nuclear weapons or not is the decision that will be made later.
